intro: Calhounia suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-smelling calhounia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with a fragrant scent. Its leaves are ovate and have a soft, velvety texture. Calhounia suaveolens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats.
